result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:21 AM - cases called - 22Cf09, 21CF04 and 20CF179.  Defendant Daniel J. Horwath appeared by video, in custody from the Juneau County Jail.  Attorney Galen Bayne-Allison in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John D Mathie in court for Daniel J. Horwath.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison regarding status of these matters.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Court questions Atty Mathie/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Mathie/Defendant.  Defendant consents to appearing via Zoom.  Recess taken at 10:23 AM.  Back on the record at 10:30 AM.  Parties are ready to proceed with the preliminary hearing in 22CF09.  Officer Robert Caylor duly sworn and testifies.  Direct by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Defendant identified by Officer Caylor.  State requests the Court take judicial notice of the bonds in Lincoln County Cases No. 20CF179 and 21CF04.  Court takes judicial notice.  Cross by Atty Mathie.  Argument by Atty Mathie.  Rebuttal by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty to all counts in 22CF09.  Court accepts not guilty pleas in 22CF09.  Bond will continue in 22CF09.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison regarding bail bond forfeiture hearings in 20CF179 and 21CF04.  Court will adjourn the bail bond forfeiture hearings.
